meanings.definition: Subjected to high temperatures in the absence of oxygen, causing decomposition.
meanings.sent1: The pyrolysed wood turned into charcoal after being heated without air.
meanings.sent2: The scientist studied the pyrolysed material under a microscope.
meanings.sent3: The pyrolysed plastic melted into a colorful puddle on the floor.
meanings.sent4: The pyrolysed leaves crumbled into dust with a gentle touch.
meanings.sent5: The smell of the pyrolysed paper filled the room with a burnt aroma.

meanings.definition: Treated with heat to break down into simpler compounds.
meanings.sent1: The chef pyrolysed the vegetables to create a flavorful sauce.
meanings.sent2: The company pyrolysed the waste materials to reduce environmental impact.
meanings.sent3: The magician pyrolysed the playing cards, turning them into confetti.
meanings.sent4: The artist pyrolysed the clay, transforming it into a beautiful sculpture.
meanings.sent5: The blacksmith pyrolysed the metal, shaping it into intricate designs.
